trans-unit.source: Indicates that a rule is updating a variable, in order to cause reevaluation of affected rules.

This class is used to indicate to the rules engine that execution of this rule's set of actions causes a change to the field or property that is specified (or all fields and properties on an object), so that any rules that are dependent on this field or property can be reevaluated.
An `Update` call does not prevent other actions in the action block from executing.

The set of fields/properties that are modified (specified through `Update` or by using <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleWriteAttribute>s on methods invoked) is used to determine chaining when the set of actions for this particular rule finishes executing.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleUpdateAction"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleUpdateAction"></xref> class.
To indicate that the property `this.SomeProperty` was modified, the `path` parameter would be `this/SomeProperty`.
You can specify the value changed as specifically as you prefer (for example, if you only modified `this.SomeProperty/SomeOtherProperty`, you can specify `this/SomeProperty/SomeOtherProperty`).
In the latter case, other rules that used `this.SomeProperty/AnyOtherProperty` would not be reevaluated.
To specify that all fields and properties are modified, append "*" to the end of the path.
For example, `this/SomeProperty/*` indicates that all fields and properties on `this.SomeProperty` were modified.
Therefore, all rules that use any field or property on `this.SomeProperty` would be reevaluated.
If the rule set is run with <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleSet.ChainingBehavior%2A> set to <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleChainingBehavior.None>, this action is ignored.
A string that represents the name of the field or property changed.
The character "/" is used as a separator.
Creates a deep copy of the current <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleAction"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleAction"></xref> that is identical to this instance.
Determines whether two object instances are equal.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to compare with the current <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
`true` if the objects are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Executes the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleAction"></xref> using the specified <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleExecution"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleExecution"></xref> context used to execute the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleAction"></xref>.
Returns the hash code for this instance.
The hash code for this instance.
Returns the fields and properties updated by a <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleAction"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleValidation"></xref> to manage the validation process.
A list of the fields and properties changed by a <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleAction"></xref>.
Gets or sets the path of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleUpdateAction"></xref>.
<xref:System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleUpdateAction.Path%2A> is a string that represents the name of the field or property that is changed.
"/" is used as a separator.
To indicate that the property `this.SomeProperty` has been modified, the property would be "`this/SomeProperty`".
You can specify the changed value as specifically as you prefer (for example, if you only modified `this.SomeProperty/SomeOtherProperty`, you can specify "`this/SomeProperty/SomeOtherProperty`").
In the latter case, other rules that used `this.SomeProperty/AnyOtherProperty` would not be reevaluated.
To specify that all fields and properties are modified, append "*" to the end of the path.
For example, "`this/SomeProperty/*`" indicates that all fields and properties on `this.SomeProperty` have been modified.
Therefore, all rules that use any field or property on `this.SomeProperty` would be reevaluated.
If the rule set is run with <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleSet.ChainingBehavior%2A> set to <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleChainingBehavior.None>, this action is ignored.
The path of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleUpdateAction"></xref>.
Returns a string that indicates the field or property that the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.Rule"></xref> is updating.
The string "Update <<xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleUpdateAction.Path"></xref>>".
Verifies that the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleAction"></xref> is configured correctly and has no errors.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleValidation"></xref> to manage the validation process.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleAction"></xref> has no errors; otherwise, `false`.
